column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I took one of my friends from out of town to get the "best" chicago pizza at Lou Malnati's. We came around 1:45 PM and just missed the lunch rush
column2: so we were seated right away. Because we knew that it would take 30 minutes for our pizza to cook
column3: we ordered the Malnati Salad while waiting. It was surprisingly really refreshing and enjoyable. I would highly recommend the salad while waiting for the pizza. When the Malnati Chicago Classic arrived
column4: we were severely disappointed. The pizza was super dry due to the thin layer of tomato sauce even though there was thick layer of cheese and sausage. Although my friend and I agreed that the crust was a lot better than Giordanos and Ginos
column5: we sadly both agreed that we liked the pizza at Giordanos more. Â
